thread.title: Australian Antonio Bagnato sentenced to death in Thailand over Hells Angel murder
thread.title_full: Australian Antonio Bagnato sentenced to death in Thailand over Hells Angel murder

author: Ron Corbin
title: Australian Antonio Bagnato sentenced to death in Thailand over Hells Angel murder
text:
Australian Antonio Bagnato sentenced to death in Thailand over Hells Angel murder Ron Corbin twitter TWEET More 
Bangkok: Australian man Antonio Bagnato has been found guilty and sentenced to death by a Thai court for his role in the 2015 abduction and murder of Hells Angels gang member Wayne Schneider. 
Antonio Bagnato, 28, was charged over the abduction and killing of Schneider, a former Hells Angel bikie, at a villa complex in the seaside resort of Pattaya, 150 kilometres from Bangkok, in 2015. SHARE Pin to Pinterest PIN Link Tony Bang - Antonio Bagnato - also known as "Tony Bang" - when he fought muay thai in Sydney's south in 2012. 
Bagnato, a kickboxer and one-time business associate of Schneider, had pleaded not guilty . 
He and 22-year-old American Tyler Gerard were arrested soon after the murder. Bagnato was detained in a hotel in Phnom Penh while Gerard was arrested as he attempted to cross the Thai border into Cambodia. Related Content Australian bikie believed to have fled from Thailand to Dubai 
Schneider's naked body was found days later in a shallow grave about 30 kilometres from the luxury villa where the initial assault occurred. 
At a court appearance in November, Bagnato was identified by two witnesses as being present at the scene of Schneider's abduction when he was bundled into a utility. Advertisement 
A GPS indicator fitted to the rental helped police locate the body. 
Bagnato and Schneider had been partners in a boxing gym in Sydney and were facing Australian police investigations linked to international drug deals and a separate murder in Australia. SHARE
